text: What a lovely treat!: Quite frankly, I'm suprised that no one has ever done a Kate Bush tribute album. And Tom Dunning rises gloriously to the occasion. Clearly everyone involved in this album considers this a labor of love, and it makes for a delightful listen.Some of my favorite tracks? "There Goes a Tenner" is rendered in trippy-hippy-hoppy-happy fashion - clever and fun. "Hounds of Love" is just lovely to listen to, perhaps even better than la Kate's version. Those who chose to cover the B-sides have my devotion, as those are among my own personal favorites. And the tracks I didn't love, well, I didn't love 'em to begin with.Simply put, if you're a fan of Kate, you owe it to yourself to add this to your collection - and if you're trying to introduce any of your friends to la Kate, this album could only aid you in your cause.
